channel.title: Let God Be True!
channel.description: let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written... Romans 3:4

item.title: Intro: The Covenants of God (10)
item.description: God's covenants with men are a large part of the Bible. A covenant is a compact or contract dictating how persons will treat each other. The glorious Creator God chose to bind Himself by covenant to save His elect people. Hallelujah! Amen!
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God's covenants with men are a large part of the Bible. A covenant is a compact or contract dictating how persons will treat each other. The glorious Creator God chose to bind Himself by covenant to save His elect people. Hallelujah! Amen!

item.title: Intro: The Last Song of Moses (1)
item.description: In Deuteronomy 32 are Moses' last words to Israel before he died in Mt. Nebo. Moses feared their evil character and warned severely of Jehovah's judgment if they did not wisely respond to His goodness by obedience and loyalty to His law.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: In Deuteronomy 32 are Moses' last words to Israel before he died in Mt. Nebo. Moses feared their evil character and warned severely of Jehovah's judgment if they did not wisely respond to His goodness by obedience and loyalty to His law.

item.title: Intro: Two Kings and Their Laws (1)
item.description: Sin and death reign over men since Adam as unalterable laws. Bildad called death King of Terrors. Now righteousness and life reign by the Prince of Life for believers. Learn the terrible plight of sinners and our grand redemption in Christ.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Sin and death reign over men since Adam as unalterable laws. Bildad called death King of Terrors. Now righteousness and life reign by the Prince of Life for believers. Learn the terrible plight of sinners and our grand redemption in Christ.

item.title: Intro: Cleaving Unto the Lord
item.description: Persecution drove the gospel north to Antioch of Syria. Barnabas came to see the Gentile converts and exhort them to cleave to Christ. He knew the threats to their zeal, which are similar to our own. Let us run to Christ and never let go.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Persecution drove the gospel north to Antioch of Syria. Barnabas came to see the Gentile converts and exhort them to cleave to Christ. He knew the threats to their zeal, which are similar to our own. Let us run to Christ and never let go.

item.title: Sermon: Trusting the God of Politics
item.description: Rather than look at the Bible's precepts for submission to civil government, it is helpful to recall the persons involved and how God reversed many political situations for the benefit of His children, just as He has for us and will for us.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Rather than look at the Bible's precepts for submission to civil government, it is helpful to recall the persons involved and how God reversed many political situations for the benefit of His children, just as He has for us and will for us.

item.title: Intro: Jesus the Son of God (3) Slides
item.description: Slides to show Jesus fulfilled Psalm 2 by resurrection and coronation, as Paul taught in Hebrews 1 and 5 and Acts 13. Eternal sonship and a deferred kingdom are both refuted by many scriptures combined for the truth of Jesus Christ's Lordship.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Slides to show Jesus fulfilled Psalm 2 by resurrection and coronation, as Paul taught in Hebrews 1 and 5 and Acts 13. Eternal sonship and a deferred kingdom are both refuted by many scriptures combined for the truth of Jesus Christ's Lordship.

item.title: Intro: Jewels of Calvary in Hebrews (2)
item.description: Hebrews has a single and simple theme - the preeminence of Jesus Christ. Written to Jews used to a sacrifical system involving priests, Paul made many comparisons to show our Lord's death far superior to any O.T. priest or offering.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Are You Saved?
item.description: Judgment Day is fast approaching, when you will be judged and sent to hell or allowed into heaven. Any other fear of man like Covid-19 is nothing in comparison. Do you have Bible evidence to be sure of heaven? It is crucially important!
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Judgment Day is fast approaching, when you will be judged and sent to hell or allowed into heaven. Any other fear of man like Covid-19 is nothing in comparison. Do you have Bible evidence to be sure of heaven? It is crucially important!

item.title: Sermon: Froward Spouses
item.description: Human relations involve sinners, so they will frustrate or hurt at times. Marriage has two sinners closer for longer than any other. Your spouse will upset you. What will you do then? It is only in this situation you can truly please God.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Human relations involve sinners, so they will frustrate or hurt at times. Marriage has two sinners closer for longer than any other. Your spouse will upset you. What will you do then? It is only in this situation you can truly please God.

item.title: Intro: Romans 1:26-32 Slides
item.description: When men reject God's obvious existence by creation, He may rewire them to do perverse things. Sodomy is His judgment, not a cause for judgment. But there are many more dysfunctional things He turns men over to as well. Beware!
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: When men reject God's obvious existence by creation, He may rewire them to do perverse things. Sodomy is His judgment, not a cause for judgment. But there are many more dysfunctional things He turns men over to as well. Beware!

item.title: Intro: Romans 1:18-25
item.description: God's wrath is coming from heaven against the wicked. As Paul wrote, He gave all men opportunities to know Him, glorify Him, thank Him, and obey Him. They did not and instead invented lies, so He blinded and rewired them to sexual folly.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Sermon: What Drives & Sustains You?
item.description: You do what you do by influences and goals you allow or choose. To please God and live victoriously, you must reset the factors for your priorities. Listen for the three reasons that should rule your life for God's glory and your success.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: You do what you do by influences and goals you allow or choose. To please God and live victoriously, you must reset the factors for your priorities. Listen for the three reasons that should rule your life for God's glory and your success.

item.title: Intro: Romans 1:16
item.description: Paul's systematic theology starts here. He will indict Gentiles, then Jews, and then both. He will condemn mankind by creation, providence, conscience, and scripture. But he first summarizes the gospel of Christ for believers.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul's systematic theology starts here. He will indict Gentiles, then Jews, and then both. He will condemn mankind by creation, providence, conscience, and scripture. But he first summarizes the gospel of Christ for believers.

item.title: Sermon: Songs & Their Stories (2)
item.description: Apostolic religion requires singing with the understanding. The words teach and admonish each other in congregational worship. Like the scribal notations give perspective to Psalms (18,34,51,52), so do the stories behind our favorite hymns.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Apostolic religion requires singing with the understanding. The words teach and admonish each other in congregational worship. Like the scribal notations give perspective to Psalms (18,34,51,52), so do the stories behind our favorite hymns.

item.title: Intro: Doctrine of Matthew 22 (3)
item.description: Jesus blasted the Jews with six lessons that utterly confounded them. The same truth confounds most Christians today. Here are six ancient landmarks of the apostolic faith presented by the Master of truth, wisdom, logic, and rhetoric.

item.title: Sermon: Destruction of Jerusalem Slides
item.description: This important prophetic event of 70 A.D. was foretold throughout the Bible. From Deuteronomy to Hebrews, these slides review prophecies other than our Lord's Olivet Discourse. Most Christians no longer know this key event.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: This important prophetic event of 70 A.D. was foretold throughout the Bible. From Deuteronomy to Hebrews, these slides review prophecies other than our Lord's Olivet Discourse. Most Christians no longer know this key event.

item.title: Intro: Parables of Matthew 13 (1)
item.description: Jesus used many parables in this chapter to hide truth from some and reveal it to others. There are eight parables teaching five key lessons about different aspects of the N.T. gospel kingdom of Jesus Christ. Learn and apply the lessons.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus used many parables in this chapter to hide truth from some and reveal it to others. There are eight parables teaching five key lessons about different aspects of the N.T. gospel kingdom of Jesus Christ. Learn and apply the lessons.

item.title: Intro: Glory of God in Salvation (1)
item.description: God planned salvation so He only gets glory for it (I Cor 1:29-31). He chose to save those the world calls base or foolish, and His choice determines their response to the gospel. He sent His Son to secure four glorious things for them only.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God planned salvation so He only gets glory for it (I Cor 1:29-31). He chose to save those the world calls base or foolish, and His choice determines their response to the gospel. He sent His Son to secure four glorious things for them only.

item.itunes:summary: God planned salvation so He only gets glory for it (I Cor 1:29-31). He chose to save those the world calls base or foolish, and His choice determines their response to the gospel. He sent His Son to secure four glorious things for them only.

item.title: Intro: Jesus Is Our Yea and Amen (6)
item.description: Pharisees despised Jesus for loving repentant sinners. He came to save such sinners. Learn to hate the vile spirit of Pharisaism in yourself or in others. Jesus will never cast out a sinner coming to Him. He loves big sinners, knowing they love more.

item.title: Sermon: A Teachable Spirit
item.description: A teachable spirit is a key trait for success with God and men. David and Solomon emphasized it. We arrive in life ignorant, so we must be taught everything. Growth requires change, and change requires criticism and reformation.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Psalm: Ebenezer: Stone of Help (1)
item.description: Samuel led a great revival in Israel and beat the Philistines with God's help. This sermon is background and context. Samuel burned a sucking lamb to secure God's help and honored Him with a memorial - Hitherto hath the LORD helped us.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Mercy for Rebel Anarchists
item.description: As anarchists loot, riot, and burn in several cities, godly men are angry. But God promised the godly and evil would be perpetual enemies. Yet still God is far angrier at us for our sins, but He mercifully forgave us our crimes and adopted us.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Sermon: Nails and Bulls Slides
item.description: At a men's meeting, lessons from Isaiah 22 (Shebna and Eliakim) and Isaiah 51 (young men as bulls) were used. Eliakim was the nail for his family tree and an example for godly men. Cities need young men to be bulls, but Judah had none.

item.title: Intro: God As Our Father (1)
item.description: For Father's Day we lifted our eyes to our heavenly Father to delight in Him for 20 spectacular traits that make Him far better than a perfect earthly father we might imagine. Adoption as sons is the sweetest gift of God's gracious salvation.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Sermon: God As Our Father (2)
item.description: After reviewing 20 traits of God as our Father, we studied 20 duties that make us better children for our Father's delight and glory. This sermon should convict change to be more like God our Father in our character and doctrine while here.

item.title: Intro: The Crucifixion in I Timothy 3:16
item.description: The inspired summary of truth Paul gave Timothy for the apostolic churches has six glorious phrases. Where is the crucifixion? It is found in each of the six events, if you stop to consider the richness and depth of the summary list. Hallelujah!
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Sermon: Christ of I Timothy 3:16 Slides
item.description: Slide presentation to review a key N.T. verse summarizing the gospel. The six facts here are greater than all events of human history. We must learn and love the Man Christ Jesus that did all these great things for us, especially as Gentile pagans.

item.title: Intro: Review of Isaiah 45-66 Slides
item.description: Slides are used to summarize each chapter of Isaiah from the recent sermon series. The purpose is to jog memories of the good things learned at the end of a long series. Extensive notes are on the website for deeper study of any verse.

item.title: Sermon: Men Share Favorites of Isaiah
item.description: God mercifully showed us precious things from Isaiah's many chapters and verses. Though still limited by the pandemic rules, about 20 men shared favorite verses from Isaiah. The variety reflects experiences of different men and Holy Spirit use.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 65
item.description: God justly punished the Jews, and He introduced Himself to Gentiles that had not sought Him. He saved only a small elect part of Israel. He exalted the big difference election makes, and He described Christ's N.T. gospel kingdom gloriously.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 66
item.description: Two great events occurred around Jesus - Jerusalem was burned, and the gospel exploded. God mocked the Jews trust in ceremonies and promised vengeance. He united Jews and Gentiles in the church and exalted them over enemies.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Two great events occurred around Jesus - Jerusalem was burned, and the gospel exploded. God mocked the Jews trust in ceremonies and promised vengeance. He united Jews and Gentiles in the church and exalted them over enemies.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah - Chapter 63
item.description: God as an angry, mighty avenger destroyed Edom, the perpetual enemy of Israel. Isaiah then led a review of God's love and mercy to Israel. On that basis He prayed God would see their plight in Babylon and deliver them like from Egypt.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah - Chapter 64
item.description: After chapter 63, Isaiah prayed for God to terrify Babylon by His mighty power. Remembering the law of Moses, Isaiah confessed the accumulated sins of the nation and begged God for mercy based on their relationship and worship.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: After chapter 63, Isaiah prayed for God to terrify Babylon by His mighty power. Remembering the law of Moses, Isaiah confessed the accumulated sins of the nation and begged God for mercy based on their relationship and worship.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 62
item.description: Isaiah and pastors of the Jewish church prayed for God's promises to be fulfilled. God swore to always protect them. In addition to prayer, they prepared for the worldwide growth, which began with John the Baptist and then by the apostles.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Isaiah and pastors of the Jewish church prayed for God's promises to be fulfilled. God swore to always protect them. In addition to prayer, they prepared for the worldwide growth, which began with John the Baptist and then by the apostles.

item.title: Intro: Nations - Blessed or Cursed
item.description: What makes a nation great? Why is America a great nation? God blesses or curses nations as they protect or promote His gospel and church. Christians must know the divine and spiritual facts, rules, and forces in play in world politics.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: What makes a nation great? Why is America a great nation? God blesses or curses nations as they protect or promote His gospel and church. Christians must know the divine and spiritual facts, rules, and forces in play in world politics.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 60
item.description: Arise! Shine! God gave the Jewish church His Son, His gospel, and many Gentile conversions. After 70 years of captivity and 400 years of obscurity, God blessed the Jewish church with David's Son for great joy and unity of Jews and Gentiles.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 61
item.description: Jesus fulfilled this prophecy in His hometown synagogue. But there is more than Jesus read. The Jewish church would explode with growth by many Gentile conversions. God exalted the elect Jews and changed them for their great joy forever.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus fulfilled this prophecy in His hometown synagogue. But there is more than Jesus read. The Jewish church would explode with growth by many Gentile conversions. God exalted the elect Jews and changed them for their great joy forever.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 58
item.description: A glorious chapter! God blasted hypocritical worship like today's carnal Christianity. But He gave many rich promises for godly conduct, with the emphasis on charity and mercy with all others. Embrace these precious promises.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: A glorious chapter! God blasted hypocritical worship like today's carnal Christianity. But He gave many rich promises for godly conduct, with the emphasis on charity and mercy with all others. Embrace these precious promises.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 59
item.description: God deserted Israel for their sins. He listed many of their sins, which left the nation hopeless. Isaiah interceded for them. God promised to save them by Himself due to lack of a Deliverer. Messiah would save the elect and bless them forever.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 56
item.description: Messiah's kingdom is for all people, so Isaiah comforted eunuchs and Gentiles. God measures men by character and conduct, not anything else. God had called Babylon to devour the nation, and He blasted their wicked pastors.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 57
item.description: With terrible judgment coming, God took righteous men to heaven. He then mocked the idolatry and spiritual adultery of the nation. He promised to save the remnant in spite of themselves, though there would no peace to the wicked.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: With terrible judgment coming, God took righteous men to heaven. He then mocked the idolatry and spiritual adultery of the nation. He promised to save the remnant in spite of themselves, though there would no peace to the wicked.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 54
item.description: God promised the Jewish church would explode in size, including many Gentiles. He would take her back like a loving husband and never reject her again. Prosperity and protection were guaranteed to her and to her children forever.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God promised the Jewish church would explode in size, including many Gentiles. He would take her back like a loving husband and never reject her again. Prosperity and protection were guaranteed to her and to her children forever.

item.title: Sermon: Isaiah 55
item.description: The gospel has a feast of fat things for the soul to find great delight. It includes the Son of David as leader and commander and abundant pardon for backsliders. His word is certain - the prosperity sure - for God's own name, sign, and glory.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: The gospel has a feast of fat things for the soul to find great delight. It includes the Son of David as leader and commander and abundant pardon for backsliders. His word is certain - the prosperity sure - for God's own name, sign, and glory.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 53 Slides
item.description: Slides detail this chapter foretelling the glorious work of salvation by God's Servant Messiah - our Lord Jesus. The Jews despised and rejected Him, but God punished Him for our sins. We were thereby justified, and He was glorified.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Slides detail this chapter foretelling the glorious work of salvation by God's Servant Messiah - our Lord Jesus. The Jews despised and rejected Him, but God punished Him for our sins. We were thereby justified, and He was glorified.

item.title: Intro: The Master of Disease Slides
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has the world terrified, but Jesus rules all disease. Ten axioms tell the cause, reasons, and cure for disease. Take comfort that Jesus is in full control of COVID-19 as much as He was the Sea of Galilee with His apostles.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: The coronavirus pandemic has the world terrified, but Jesus rules all disease. Ten axioms tell the cause, reasons, and cure for disease. Take comfort that Jesus is in full control of COVID-19 as much as He was the Sea of Galilee with His apostles.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 51
item.description: God comforted captive Jews with deliverance and future blessings. He told them to think of Abraham. He would save by almighty power from their impotent condition. Their sons/bulls could not help. He would turn fury on their enemies.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 52
item.description: God comforted His captives in exile and introduced Messiah His Servant. God would save His people and bless them into the N.T. The last three verses introduce Isaiah 53. Jesus was promoted to highest glory for saving His elect.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 50
item.description: Israel deserved the captivity due to sins. Then Jesus spoke in prophecy of God teaching Him and His faithful use of God's gifts. He let men crucify Him, but with God's help He mocked His adversaries and their vain ideas and plans.

item.title: Intro: Fear, Faith, Facts, Fables
item.description: Coronavirus fear is everywhere, but Christians should be full of faith. They should exalt facts over fables in the media feeding frenzy of terrifying Americans. There is a godly balance to deal with the world's constant fear tactics.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Coronavirus fear is everywhere, but Christians should be full of faith. They should exalt facts over fables in the media feeding frenzy of terrifying Americans. There is a godly balance to deal with the world's constant fear tactics.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 48
item.description: God reproved Israel for sins in spite of His fulfilled prophecies and chastening. He chose to end the time in Babylon for His own name's sake. He showed His care of Israel by sending Cyrus, but the reason for their trouble was their fault.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God reproved Israel for sins in spite of His fulfilled prophecies and chastening. He chose to end the time in Babylon for His own name's sake. He showed His care of Israel by sending Cyrus, but the reason for their trouble was their fault.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 49
item.description: The chapter begins by an intimate exchange between Messiah and God. He would have more success with Gentiles than with Jews. He would unite Jews and Gentiles to be a great kingdom with numbers beyond belief given the situation.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: The chapter begins by an intimate exchange between Messiah and God. He would have more success with Gentiles than with Jews. He would unite Jews and Gentiles to be a great kingdom with numbers beyond belief given the situation.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 46
item.description: God comforted the captive Jews in Babylon that He was superior to idols by nature, by fulfilled prophecy, and by righteous salvation. While Persia would carry Babylon's idols away, God carries His people from birth to old age.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God comforted the captive Jews in Babylon that He was superior to idols by nature, by fulfilled prophecy, and by righteous salvation. While Persia would carry Babylon's idols away, God carries His people from birth to old age.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 47
item.description: God mocked Babylon as a virgin daughter to be disgraced by the Persians and as a lady doomed to widowhood and loss of children. God would destroy Babylon for her sorcery and witchcraft. Her satanic advisors would not stop Him at all.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God mocked Babylon as a virgin daughter to be disgraced by the Persians and as a lady doomed to widowhood and loss of children. God would destroy Babylon for her sorcery and witchcraft. Her satanic advisors would not stop Him at all.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 44
item.description: God comforted Israel that He had great things in store for them. He ridiculed the folly of idolatry and explained He blinded such men. He had forgiven Israel and would send Cyrus to save them from Babylon to fulfill prophecies of their return.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God comforted Israel that He had great things in store for them. He ridiculed the folly of idolatry and explained He blinded such men. He had forgiven Israel and would send Cyrus to save them from Babylon to fulfill prophecies of their return.

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 45
item.description: God promised Cyrus and Israel He would use Cyrus for His glory to restore His people to Jerusalem. He declared His sovereign rule over all men, and though His work was not always seen, He would eradicate idolatry for His own final glory.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 43
item.description: God promised Israel He would save them from Babylon; He would exchange others for them. He would regather them as a nation and prove He was the only God. They deserved the captivity, but He would save them for His own sake.

item.title: Sermon: Right Side Up - 2020 (#2) Slides
item.description: Slides to show the horrible danger of spatial disorientation for pilots and divers. They must learn their instruments to fly in bad weather. Christians must learn the Bible to survive the bad weather of this wicked world and their own lusts.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 42
item.description: God would send His Servant - Jesus our Lord - and He would greatly bless His ministry to save the Gentiles from their blindness and idolatry. Hallelujah! But He would also destroy the Jews, who rebelled against greater privileges.

item.title: Sermon: The Price of Your Soul
item.description: Jesus asked, What if a man shall gain the whole world and lose his own soul? God describes salvation and discipleship in economic terms. Daily choices show how you value your soul. Jesus dying for sinners shows the soul price of salvation.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus asked, What if a man shall gain the whole world and lose his own soul? God describes salvation and discipleship in economic terms. Daily choices show how you value your soul. Jesus dying for sinners shows the soul price of salvation.

item.title: Intro: Rude Preachers Review
item.description: Newell Eastland reviewed Bible examples and principles as to why God's ministers, even John, Jesus, and Paul, were rude in preaching content and style at times. They were opposite most preachers today pandering to compromisers.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Newell Eastland reviewed Bible examples and principles as to why God's ministers, even John, Jesus, and Paul, were rude in preaching content and style at times. They were opposite most preachers today pandering to compromisers.

item.title: Sermon: John 1:1-18 Review
item.description: Jonah Unger taught the glory of Jesus Christ, the Word of God made flesh, from John's preamble to His gospel. This section is dense with truth about the nature and ministry of John and Jesus, with Jesus the Life and Light and Savior.

item.title: Intro: Rapture Heresy Refuted
item.description: Jim Cutler presented the modern heresy of a secret rapture and then refuted it by the Bible. Jesus is certainly coming again, but not in the way or with the timing Futurists have invented and popularized in the last 150 years.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: Jim Cutler presented the modern heresy of a secret rapture and then refuted it by the Bible. Jesus is certainly coming again, but not in the way or with the timing Futurists have invented and popularized in the last 150 years.

item.title: Sermon: Strangers and Pilgrims
item.description: Adam Wells reminded the church that this world is not our home - we seek one to come. We are only passing through. We are the sons of God. These facts about God's children should affect our perspective and choices in life.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby

item.title: Intro: Isaiah 41
item.description: God called the nations of the earth to a debate to prove their idols were worthless. The topic for the debate was the rise of Cyrus the Persian to rescue the Jews and send them back home to Jerusalem.

item.description: God ordained submission to rulers, contradicting Christian "patriots." Paul and Peter taught obedience to Nero. Our fathers lived under other persecuting powers. We can easily live well under President Obama without fear for four more years.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Crosby
item.itunes:subtitle: God ordained submission to rulers, contradicting Christian "patriots." Paul and Peter taught obedience to Nero. Our fathers lived under other persecuting powers. We can easily live well under President Obama without fear for four more years.
